step_by_step_thinking: The patient presents with bilateral hearing loss, gait unsteadiness, and tingling, along with a mutation in the NF2 gene (merlin) on chromosome 22. NF2 is associated with neurofibromatosis type 2, which predisposes to bilateral vestibular schwannomas (causing hearing loss and balance issues) and meningiomas. Among the options, meningioma (B) is directly linked to NF2 mutations. Other options (renal cell carcinoma, astrocytoma, vascular malformations) are not associated with NF2.
